intro: Doemia aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough, hairy texture. Doemia aethiopica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional remedies.
